PLANNING COMMISSION
§ 32.01 ESTABLISHMENT.
   A Planning Commission is hereby created under authority of the ILCS Chapter
65, Act 5, §§ 11-12-4 through 11-12-12.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-1) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
§ 32.02 MEMBERSHIP.
   The Planning Commission shall consist of seven members. Members of the
Planning Commission shall reside within the village or within territory
contiguous to the village and not more than 1 miles beyond the corporate limits
and not included within any other municipality. The members shall be appointed
by the Mayor on the basis of their particular fitness for their duty on the
Planning Commission and subject to the approval of the Village Board.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-2) (Ord. 93-16, passed 5-19-93)
§ 32.03 TERM OF OFFICE.
   The members shall serve for a period of three years. Vacancies shall be
filled by appointment for the unexpired term only. All members of the
Commission shall serve without compensation, except that if the Village Board
deems it advisable, they may receive compensation, as provided by the Village
Board, by appropriation.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-3) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
§ 32.04 PROCEDURE.
   (A)   The Planning Commission shall elect such officers as it may deem
necessary and adopt rules and regulations of organization and procedure
consistent with the village code and state law.
   (B)   The Commission shall keep written records of its proceedings.
   (C)   It shall be open at all times for and to the inspection of the public
and the Commission shall file an annual report with the Mayor and Village
Board, setting forth its transactions and recommendations.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-4) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
§ 32.05 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The Planning Commission shall have the following powers and duties:
   (A)   (1)   To prepare and recommend to the Village Board a comprehensive
plan for the present and future development or redevelopment of the village and
contiguous unincorporated territory not more than 1 1/2 miles beyond the
corporate limits of the village and not included in any other municipality;
(The plan may be adopted in whole or in separate geographical or functional
parts, each of which, when adopted, shall be the official comprehensive plan or
part thereof of the village. The plan shall be advisory, except as to such part
thereof as has been implemented by ordinances duly enacted by the Village
Board.)
      (2)   All requirements for public hearing, filing of notice of adoption
with the County Recorder of Deeds, and filing of the plan and ordinances with
the Village Clerk shall be complied with as provided for by law; (To provide
for the health, safety, comfort and convenience of the inhabitants of the
village and contiguous territory, the plan or plans shall establish reasonable
standards of design for subdivisions and for re-subdivisions of unimproved land
and of areas subject to redevelopment in respect to public improvements, as
herein defined, and shall establish reasonable requirements governing the
location, width, course and surfacing of public streets and highways, alleys,
ways for public service facilities, curbs, gutters, sidewalks, street lights,
parks, playgrounds, school grounds, size of lots to be used for residential
purposes, storm water drainage, water supply and distribution, sanitary sewers
and sewage collection and treatment. The requirements specified herein shall
become regulatory only when adopted by law.)
   (B)   To designate land suitable for annexation to the village and the
recommended zoning classification for the land upon annexation;
   (C)   To recommend to the Village Board from time to time, the changes in
the comprehensive plan or any part thereof, as may be deemed necessary;
   (D)   To prepare and recommend to the Village Board from time to time, plans
and/or recommendations for specific improvements in pursuance to the official
comprehensive plan;
   (E)   To give aid to the officials of the village charged with the direction
of projects for improvements embraced within the official plan or parts
thereof, to further the making of the improvements and generally, to promote
the realization of the official comprehensive plan;
   (F)   To arrange and conduct any form of publicity relative to its
activities for the general purpose of public understanding;
   (G)   To cooperate with municipal or regional planning commissions and other
agencies or groups to further the local plan program and to assure harmonious
and integrated planning for the area, subject to approval of the Village Board;
and
   (H)   To exercise such other powers germane to the powers granted under
authority of an act of the General Assembly of the state, as may be conferred
by the Village Board.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-5) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
§ 32.06 LAND SUBDIVISION OR RE-SUBDIVISION; OFFICIAL MAP.
   (A)   At any time or times before or after the formal adoption of the
official comprehensive plan by the corporate authorities, an official map may
be designated by ordinance, which may consist of the whole area included within
the official comprehensive plan or one or more geographical or functional parts
and may include all or any part of the contiguous unincorporated area within 1
miles from the corporate limits of the village.
   (B)   All requirements for public hearing, filing notice of adoption with
the County Recorder of Deeds and filing of the plan and ordinances, including
the official map with the Clerk shall be complied with as provided for by law.
No map or plat of any subdivision or re-subdivision presented for record
affecting land within the corporate limits of the village or within contiguous
territory which is not more than 1 miles beyond the corporate limits shall be
entitled to record or shall be valid unless the subdivision shown thereon
provides for standards of design and standards governing streets, alleys,
public ways, ways for public service facilities, street lights, public grounds,
size of lots to be used for residential purposes and distribution, sanitary
sewers and sewage collection and treatment in conformity with the applicable
requirements of the code, including the official map.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-6) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
Statutory reference:
   Land subdivision and re-subdivision, see ILCS Chapter 65, Act 5, § 11-12-12
§ 32.07 IMPROVEMENTS.
   The Village Clerk shall furnish the Planning Commission, for its
consideration, a copy of all ordinances, plans and data relative to public
improvements of any nature. The Planning Commission may report, in relation
thereto, if it deems a report necessary or advisable, for the consideration of
the Village Board.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-7) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
§ 32.08 FURTHER PURPOSES.
   The Commission shall recommend the boundaries of districts for land use and
shall recommend regulations to the corporate authorities for the following:
   (A)   To regulate and limit the height and bulk of buildings hereafter to be
erected;
   (B)   To establish, regulate and limit the building or setback lines on or
along the street, traffic way, drive, parkway or storm or flood water runoff
channel or basin;
   (C)   To regulate and limit the intensity of the use of lot areas and to
regulate and determine the area of open spaces, within and surrounding the
buildings;
   (D)   To classify, regulate and restrict the location of trades and
industries and the location of buildings designed for specified industrial,
business, residential and other uses;
   (E)   To divide the entire municipality into districts of such number,
shape, area and of such different classes (according to use of land and
buildings, height and bulk of buildings, intensity of the use of lot area, area
of open spaces or other classification), as may be deemed best suited to carry
out the purpose of this section;
   (F)   To fix standards to which buildings or structures therein shall
conform;
   (G)   To prohibit uses, buildings or structures incompatible with the
character of the districts; and
   (H)   To prevent additions to and alteration or remodeling of existing
buildings or structures in such a way as to avoid the restrictions and
limitations lawfully imposed under this section.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-8) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
§ 32.09 EXPENDITURES.
   Expenditures of the Commission shall be at the discretion of the Village
Board and if the Commission shall deem it advisable to secure technical advice
or services, it shall be done upon authority of the Village Board and
appropriations by the Village Board therefor.
(`92 Code, § 4-1-9) (Ord. 364, passed 12-1-65)
ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
§ 32.20 ESTABLISHMENT.
   There is hereby established the Maryville Economic Development Commission,
hereinafter referred to as the Commission.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-1) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.21 PURPOSE.
   (A)   The purpose of the Economic Development Commission shall be to
actively encourage economic development, analyze proposals and make
recommendations to the Village Board concerning residential, commercial,
service, industrial and other economic development within the village and areas
near the village, within 1 miles of the corporate boundary per the
comprehensive plan.
   (B)   Functions include, but are not limited to:
      (1)   Long range economic planning;
      (2)   Community outreach through a process of promotional activities on
behalf of the village;
      (3)   Community/business liaison;
      (4)   Preserve community standards; and
      (5)   Coordinate economic development with surrounding communities.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-2) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.22 APPOINTMENT AND MEMBERSHIP.
   The Commission shall be composed of 11 members, appointed by the Mayor, with
the advice and consent of the Village Board. The members of the Commission
shall be residents of the village. No member of the Commission shall be an
elected official of the village, except that the Mayor, the Mayor’s appointed
Trustee and the Planning Commission Chairperson shall be non-voting, ex-officio
members of the Commission.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-3) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.23 TERM OF MEMBERS.
   Each voting member of the Commission shall serve a one-year term or until
the time as another appointment is made by the Mayor with the advice and
consent of the Village Board. Any voting member of the Commission may be
removed from the office upon missing three consecutive regular meetings of the
Commission, except for cause(s) approved by the Chairperson of the Commission.
The vacancy thereby created shall be filled for the unexpired term by
appointment of the Mayor with the advice and consent of the Village Board.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-4) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.24 ELECTION OF CHAIRPERSON.
   The Commissioners shall elect one of their voting members as Chairperson to
preside at meetings of the Commission and the Commission shall meet at least
once each month on a day fixed annually for regular meetings. Other meetings,
as may be desired or required by the Commission, may be called by the
Chairperson or by two other Commission members by serving written notice by
mail or personal service upon all other Commission members including ex-officio
members, the notice to be received by the recipient no less than 24 hours prior
to the date and hour of the special meeting.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-5) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.25 QUORUM.
   A majority of the members of the Commission shall constitute a quorum and no
matter coming before the Commission shall be approved unless it receives a
majority of affirmative votes of the Commission members present.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-6) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.26 FISCAL YEAR.
   The fiscal year of the Commission shall coincide with the fiscal year of the
village.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-7) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.27 OTHER OFFICERS; TERMS.
   (A)   The Commission may elect other voting members as officers as they
desire and as will serve their needs and all such officers, including the
Chairperson, shall be entitled to vote upon all matters coming before the
Commission.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-8)
   (B)   The terms of office of the officers of the Commission shall be for one
year and they shall be elected to serve at the first regular meeting in May of
each year.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-9)
   (C)   The Commission shall determine the various powers and duties of its
officers.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-10) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.28 COMPENSATION.
   No member of the Commission shall receive any compensation for services on
or to the Commission.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-11) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
§ 32.29 REPORTS TO VILLAGE.
   The Commission shall provide to the Village Board a record of all meetings
within ten days of the close of a Commission meeting. The meeting minutes shall
include the date, time and location of the meeting, a record of attendance,
information on actions taken and results achieved at the meeting.
(`92 Code, § 4-2-12) (Ord. 99-35, passed 11-17-99)
BOARD OF FIRE AND POLICE COMMISSIONERS
§ 32.40 CREATION.
   The Board of Fire and Police Commissioners of the Village of Maryville,
Illinois, hereinafter referred to as the Board, is hereby established.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.41 MEMBERSHIP.
   The Board shall consist of three members.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.42 QUALIFICATIONS.
   (A)   No person holding an office of any municipality can be a member of the
Board or secretary of the Board.
   (B)   No one who is related by blood or marriage to any elected official of
the municipality, within the degree of kinship of first cousin or closer, can
be appointed as a member of the Board.
   (C)   No person shall be appointed to the Board who has been convicted of a
felony under the laws of the State of Illinois or comparable laws of any other
state or of the United States.
   (D)   No more than two members of the Board may belong to the same political
part. Membership shall be determined by looking first to municipality party
affiliations and then to state or national party affiliations. Affiliations are
determined by affidavit of each member of the Board.
   (E)   A member of the Board must also reside within the corporate limits of
the village.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.43 TERM OF OFFICE.
   (A)   Terms of office of initial three appointees. One of the initial
members of the Board shall be appointed to serve until the end of the then
current fiscal year of the village. Another of the initial members of the Board
shall be appointed to serve until the end of the fiscal year of the village
next ensuing. The third member of the Board shall be appointed to serve until
the end of the fiscal year of the village, second next ensuing. Regardless of
these provisions, however, every member of the Board shall serve until his or
her successor is appointed and has qualified.
   (B)   Terms of office of successor members of the Board. The terms of office
of successive members of the Board shall be three years and until the
respective successors are appointed and have qualified.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.44 OATH/AFFIRMATION OF OFFICE.
   Before entering into the performance of the duties of a member of the Board,
each person appointed to that office shall first sign and file with the Village
Clerk an oath or affirmation that he or she will discharge faithfully the
duties of the office. The oath or affirmation shall be in the following form:
   I do solemnly swear (or affirm) that I will support the Constitution of the
United States, and the Constitution of the State of Illinois, and that I will
faithfully discharge the duties of the office of member of the Village of
Maryville Board of Fire and Police Commissioners according to the best of my
ability.
                                                         
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.45 FIDELITY BOND REQUIRED.
   Before entering into the performance of the duties of a member of the Board,
each person appointed to that office shall first execute a fidelity bond, in
the penal sum of $100, payable to the People of the Village of Maryville,
Illinois, guaranteeing his or her faithful performance of his or her duties as
a member of the Board. The fidelity bond shall be in the following form:
   I, __________________, bind myself to the People of the Village of
Maryville, Illinois that I will discharge faithfully the duties of the office
of member of the Maryland Board of Fire and Police Commissioners.
   The obligation of this bond is limited to $100.
      Dated: This ____ day of _________, 20__.
                                                                                    
                           Member of the Village of Maryville
                           Board of Fire and Police Commissioners
   STATE OF ILLINOIS   )
               ) SS:
   COUNTY OF MADISON   )
   I, ____________________, a notary public in and for the County of Madison
and the State of Illinois, hereby certify that _________________, known to me
to be the same person whose name is subscribed to the foregoing document,
appeared before me this day in person and acknowledged that he or she signed
the foregoing document as his or her free and voluntary act for the uses and
purposes therein set forth.
      Given under my hand and notarial seal this _____ day of _______________,
20__.
                        _________________________________
                        Notary Public
                        My commission expires: ____________
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.46 NO COMPENSATION.
   The members and the secretary of the Board shall not receive any
compensation from the village.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.47 ADOPTION OF RULES.
   The Board shall adopt the rules requires by 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-5. The Board
shall not make any rule, however, which governs the operation of the village’s
Police Department or the conduct of its members.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.48 DISCHARGE OF DUTIES.
   The Board shall perform all the duties imposed on it by 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-
1 et seq.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
§ 32.49 EXCLUSION FROM JURISDICTION.
   The position of Chief of Police of the Police Department and the position of
Chief of the Fire Department of the village are hereby excluded from the
jurisdiction of the Board.
(Ord. 2004-44, passed 11-3-04)
COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENT BOARD
§ 32.60 ESTABLISHMENT; MEMBERSHIP.
   There shall be created a Community Improvement Board for the Village of
Maryville. The Board shall consist of 13 private citizens. To be eligible to
serve as a member, the individual must be a resident of the village, own
property within the corporate boundaries of the village, or own, operate or be
an employee of a business located within the village boundaries. Members of the
Board shall be appointed by the Mayor with the advice and consent of the Board
of Trustees.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07; Am. Ord. 2012-01, passed 2-1-12; Am. Ord. 2016-
03, passed 2-17-16)
§ 32.61 PURPOSE.
   The purpose of the Community Improvement Board shall be to make
recommendations to the Board of Trustees on general and specific issues
calculated to result in an improvement of Maryville facilities, housing,
general appearance, beautification, health and welfare issues, maintenance,
and/or other aspects intended to improve the quality of life for Maryville
residents.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07)
§ 32.62 TERM.
   The term of each Board member shall be for a period of three years. Each
staggered three year term shall expire on April 30 of each year. Appointments
to fill expiring terms shall occur at the first village Board meeting in May or
as soon thereafter as practicable. Vacancies shall be filled by appointment for
the unexpired term only. Community Improvement Board members shall serve
without pay or compensation.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07; Am. Ord. 2016-03, passed 2-17-16; Am. Ord. 2017-
33, passed 9-20-17)
§ 32.63 ORGANIZATION.
   The Community Improvement Board shall elect a Chairperson and Vice
Chairperson, who shall preside over each meeting. The Mayor and Trustees will
be considered as ex officio members of the Board when attending meetings. The
Chairperson-elect and the Vice Chairperson-elect shall serve for one year. The
Secretary shall serve for one year who shall record the proceedings of each
meeting. The election for Secretary shall be held at the May meeting with the
officer elections. Officer elections shall be held at the May meeting annually.
Records of meetings shall be kept by the Secretary; a copy will be provided to
the Board of Trustees and will be made available to the public for inspection.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07; Am. Ord. 2008-43, passed 9-3-08)
§ 32.64 DUTIES.
   The Board's specific duties and powers shall consist of making
recommendations to the Board of Trustees relating to matters consistent with
the Board's purpose set forth in §
32.61. Additional duties may be assigned by the Mayor or Board of Trustees from
time to time.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07)
§ 32.65 PROCEDURES.
   The Board shall select its own areas for review and shall provide a list to
the Board of Trustees of areas it believes suitable and appropriate for its
attention. It shall establish parameters in such instances that do not infringe
on the legally assigned duties of any other official board, committee, officer
or working group of the village. The proposal will be discussed and a specific
recommendation to correct or modify the situation will be submitted to the
Board of Trustees.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07)
§ 32.66 BUDGET.
   The Board shall submit an annual budget to the Board of Trustees within 30
days of a request to do so by the Board of Trustees. The budget will consist of
specific items for which funding is requested and the amount to be budgeted for
each. The Board shall possess no power to order any actions, enforce any of the
ordinances of the village or expend any funds not specifically allocated by the
Board of Trustees and then only for the specific purpose for which allocated.
(Ord. 2007-02, passed 2-7-07)
FOREIGN FIRE INSURANCE TAX BOARD
§ 32.80 COMPOSITION; DEFINITION.
   (A)   The Village of Maryville Foreign Fire Insurance Tax Board (“Board”)
shall consist of the Fire Chief, who shall hold office by virtue of rank, and
four members, consisting of two full-time personnel and two paid-on-call
personnel. All four members shall be elected from all employees of the Fire
Department and shall have full voting privileges on any matter before the
Board. All members of the Department shall be eligible to be elected as
officers of the Department Foreign Fire Insurance Tax Board. The members of
this Board shall annually elect officers. These officers shall be a chairman, a
treasurer, and a secretary.
   (B)   For the purposes of this subchapter, the following definition shall
apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning.
      EMPLOYEE. Any full-time sworn firefighter or officer of the Maryville
Fire Department.
      PAID-ON-CALL. Firefighters who are compensated for attending trainings,
responding to emergency calls, and attending work details and meetings per
these rules and regulations, standard operating procedures, and village
ordinance, whose primary employment is not with the Maryville Fire Department.
   (C)   No probationary employee of the Department may hold an office during
the period of his or her probation.
(Ord. 2010-20, passed 9-1-10; Am. Ord. 2023-61, passed 11-1-23)
§ 32.81 ELECTION.
   (A)   The initial election of the Board shall be held prior to October 1,
2010; the terms of the officers for such election shall terminate April 30,
2012. Successor elections of the Board shall be held in April, 2012 and in the
month of April in even-numbered years thereafter. Officers shall take office on
November 1, 2010, of the initial terms and on May 1 in even-numbered years
thereafter for successor terms.
   (B)   Officers, except for the initial terms, shall serve up to and
including April 30 two years later. Officers, whether for the initial or
successor terms, shall take an oath prior to assuming office.
   (C)   The initial election shall be held in accordance with guidelines and
procedures established by a temporary three-member committee consisting of the
Mayor, the Fire Chief, and one firefighter. These individuals shall organize,
conduct and supervise the initial elections.
   (D)   The Board shall adopt all necessary rules and regulations governing
the nomination and election of such officers for subsequent elections.
(Ord. 2010-20, passed 9-1-10)
§ 32.82 POWERS; DUTIES; PROCEDURES.
   All revenue from the foreign fire insurance tax shall be received by the
Board and shall be deposited in the fund. The fund shall be managed,
maintained, and overseen by the Board and shall be held and expended according
to the following procedures:
   (A)   By December 1 of each year the officers of the Board shall approve a
preliminary budget for the expenditure of the funds received pursuant to the
foreign fire insurance tax. The officers of the Board shall, no later than
February 1, adopt a final budget for the collection and expenditure of the
foreign fire insurance tax; the budget shall be subject to the approval of the
Village of Maryville Board of Trustees. The final budget may be amended at any
time by a majority vote of the officers of the Board; any amendment shall be
subject to approval of the Village of Maryville Board of Trustees. Expenditures
shall be made only for items specifically described in the final budget as
originally adopted or subsequently amended by the Board and approved by the
Village of Maryville Board of Trustees.
   (B)   The Board shall have the power to approve the expenditure of money
from the fund for items specifically described in the approved budget.
   (C)   Any expenditure made from the fund shall be made in accordance with
village rules, regulations, practices and ordinances, as may be amended from
time to time, which govern the procurement of goods and services.
   (D)   Prior to placing any item(s) and/or service which would be placed
within any fire station(s) in the proposed budget, the Board shall submit a
written statement to the Fire Chief stating the descriptions of the items and/
or services and the proposed locations within any fire station(s). The Fire
Chief has the absolute right to prohibit any such item(s) and/or service(s) to
be placed or located into any fire station(s). If the Fire Chief decides to
allow any such item(s) and/or service into any fire station, the Fire Chief
shall also have the absolute right to prohibit the Board’s proposed physical
location of any such item(s) or rendering of service in any fire station. The
Fire Chief must respond in writing to any written statement of the Board within
30 days from his or her receipt of the statement and the Fire Chief must
explain the basis for his or her decision(s). Upon the purchase of any approved
items, title shall be placed in the name of the Village of Maryville.
   (E)   The Board may appeal, in writing, any decision of the Fire Chief
rendered pursuant to division (D) above to the Mayor who shall issue his or her
decision in writing within 21 days of his or her receipt of the Board’s written
appeal. The decision of the Mayor shall be final.
   (F)   The treasurer of the Board shall:
      (1)   Have charge and custody of and be responsible for all funds
collected by the Village of Maryville from the foreign fire insurance tax;
      (2)   Deposit all such monies in the name of the Foreign Fire Insurance
Board for the Village of Maryville Fire Department in such banks, savings and
loan associations, or other depositories as shall be authorized by the Village
of Maryville Board of Trustees;
      (3)   Invest such funds as are not immediately required in such
securities as the Village of Maryville Board of Trustees shall specify or
generally designate from time to time;
      (4)   Maintain the financial books and records of the fund;
      (5)   Provide the Village Treasurer a monthly accounting of receipts and
expenditures of the fund;
      (6)   Furnish a bond to the Village of Maryville in an amount equal to
three times the amount of foreign fire insurance tax revenue to ensure the
faithful performance of the Board treasurer of his or her duties imposed by law
and by Board rules and regulations. Fees for the bond shall be paid from the
funds collected from the foreign fire insurance tax;
      (7)   Pay the service charge levied by the Illinois Municipal League for
the collection of the foreign fire insurance tax from the proceeds of the
foreign fire insurance tax, provided such fee is chargeable by state law; and
provided that the service charge has not already been retained by the Illinois
Municipal League prior to disbursement of the tax funds.
   (G)   The officers of the Board shall provide to the Village of Maryville
Board of Trustees an annual audit of the finances of the Board. The audit shall
be performed at the end of each fiscal year in accordance with generally
accepted auditing principles by a certified public accountant. In addition, the
audit shall verify that expenditures by the Board are for the maintenance, use
and benefit of the Fire Department. The annual report shall be delivered to the
Mayor. The cost of said audit shall be paid from the funds collected from the
foreign fire insurance tax.
(Ord. 2010-20, passed 9-1-10; Am. Ord. 2023-61, passed 11-1-23)
§ 32.83 MEETINGS.
   The Board shall, in accordance with the Open Meetings Act, establish a
regular time and place for its meetings. The chairman shall preside at the
meetings and the secretary shall keep a record of all resolutions, proceedings
and actions of the Board; these records shall be open to the public. Two
members of the Board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of its
business. The affirmative vote of two members of the Board shall be necessary
to conduct or transact any business. Special meetings, with appropriate notice,
may be called by the chairman or by not less than two other members of the
Board. Any person shall be entitled to appear and be heard on any matter before
the Board.
(Ord. 2010-20, passed 9-1-10)
§ 32.84 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The Board may promulgate written rules and regulations governing Board
matters so long as such rules and regulations are not inconsistent with law.
All rules and regulations promulgated by the Board must be approved by a
majority of the members of the Village of Maryville Board of Trustees. All
rules and regulations shall be posted in each fire station, the Village Hall,
and a copy provided to the Village Clerk. Before any rule or regulation shall
become effective, such rules or regulation shall be filed with the Village
Clerk and shall be made available for public inspection. Rules or regulations
of the Board shall become effective when the ordinance enacted by the Village
of Maryville Board of Trustees becomes law. The Board secretary shall maintain
a record of all Board rules and regulations, which shall be available for
public inspection.
(Ord. 2010-20, passed 9-1-10)
§ 32.85 LIMITED FUNCTION OF BOARD.
   The Board shall be limited in function to the administration of the funds
derived from foreign fire insurance taxes as may be levied from time to time by
the Village of Maryville. Nothing in this subchapter shall give the Board any
function or authority for any other purpose. At no time shall the actions of
the Board interfere with the duties responsibilities and rights of the Fire
Chief, the Mayor, the Board of Trustees, the Board of Fire and Police
Commissioners, nor shall its actions in any way impede the ordinary, usual and
customary operation of the Fire Department.
(Ord. 2010-20, passed 9-1-10)
Cross-reference:
   Village Fire Department, see §§
33.100 through
33.131
